entries.name: Athletics
entries.properties: Ability to run, jump, climb, or perform other athletic feats.

entries.name: Intimidation
entries.properties: Ability to coerce (i.e. persuade by fear or force).

entries.name: Willpower
entries.properties: Ability to withstand physical pain, resist poison, or endure acts of excertion.  Points in Willpower modify quality of sleep checks.

entries.name: Balance
entries.properties: Ability to perform, traverse unsteady terrain, or perform other acrobatic feats.

entries.name: Stealth
entries.properties:
Ability to move unnoticed and to perceive surrounding for stealth possibilities. A stealth check is contested against the Perception of those in immediate view. Stealth is broken at the end of your turn if you fail the stealth check.
A stealth attack causes the target to be Surprised.
A stealth check can be made everytime one is completely out of view, but the check cannot be rerolled until going in and out of viewable area of anyone other than allies.
You may only move at abilityHalf move while stealthed.
Modifiers to stealth check:
  • -5 in bright light
  • -5 if moving within line of sight of anyone other than allies.
  • -5 if moving fater than abilityHalf move
  • -2 if within 10 ft of target making a perception check
  • -5 if within 5 ft of target making a perception check
  • -5 if anyone other than allies is alerted to danger
  • -10 if anyone is looking for you specifically

entries.name: Sleight of hand
entries.properties: Ability to pick locks, steal objects, or perform hand tricks.

entries.name: Persuasion
entries.properties: Ability to persuade intelligent beings by reason, truth, or bribery.

entries.name: Deception
entries.properties: Ability to persuade intelligent beings by lieing, withholding information, or other forms of deception.

entries.name: Arcana
entries.properties: Knowledge of magic, magical lore, magical creatures, and magical items. Also the ability to discover weaknesses, resistances, and immunities.

entries.name: Nature
entries.properties: Knowledge of natural plants, creatures, and habitats. Also the ability the handle animals or gain insight into their intentions.

entries.name: Perception
entries.properties: Ability to notice creatures, traps, and other features in an environment using all or specified senses.

entries.name: Inspection
entries.properties: Ability to discover clues or hidden items in a defined area.  Unlike investigation in other RPGs, searching for non-hidden loot does not require this check.

entries.name: Insight
entries.properties: Ability to read intelligent beings body language to detect internalized thoughts and truths.

entries.name: Lore
entries.properties: Knowledge of anything made or recorded by civilizations: non-magical properties of objects, history, current politics and news, local customs, city layouts, and important landmarks.

entries.name: Survival
entries.properties: Ability to survive in harsh environments by obtaining food and shelter, and the ability to track creatures.

entries.name: Appraise
entries.properties: Tries to determine value of item. It is almost impossible to accurately appraise unidentified items.

entries.name: Identify
entries.properties:
Tries to determine properties of an item.
At least 4 points in Identify are needed before attempting to identify magical items.

entries.name: Scrollcraft
entries.properties:
Attempt to create a spell that can read from a scroll.
Requires a known spell, a blank scroll, pen and ink. Only masterwork scrolls can cast spells similar in power to the typical spell. For example, most scrolls' spells will inflict half damage, or require 5 less from the ST.
Scrolls take (level of spell) hours to complete. A scroll can be written of a spell with a level <= the character's Scrollcraft points.

entries.name: Alchemy
entries.properties: Knowledge of plant, mineral, and animal part usage and the ability to combine these elements to create potions, beverages, and meals.

entries.name: Calligraphy
entries.properties: Able to write and sketch clearly and beautifully.  Can be useful for forging documents, reading challenging handwriting, or making maps.

entries.name: Woodworking
entries.properties: Able to work with wood to make wooden items and furnishings.

entries.name: Handicraft
entries.properties: Able to work with glass, wood, metal, and gems to create or repair intricate jewelry, engravings, and embeddings.

entries.name: Leatherworking
entries.properties: Able to work with leather hides to create or repair clothes, armor, bags, and footwear.

entries.name: Smithing
entries.properties: Able to work with metal to create or repair weapons and armor.

entries.name: Perform
entries.properties:
Each point in Perform allows the character to do one of the following:
  • Play a new musical instrument
  • Learn to sing
  • Learn to dance
  • Learn to act
  • Learn magic tricks

entries.name: Mechanic
entries.properties: Able to tinker with mechanisms to create or repair mechanical objects.
